slides.title: Welcome to Medieval Science
slides.content:
# Introduction to Medieval Science

Welcome to **Medieval Science** - 500-1500 CE!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Islamic Golden Age** - Preservation and innovation
- **Medieval Astronomy** - Building towards Copernicus
- **Scholasticism** - Reason and faith
- **Early Optics** - Understanding light

> **Fun Fact:** The word 'algorithm' comes from the name of Persian mathematician al-Khwarizmi!

slides.title: Islamic Golden Age
slides.content:
# The Islamic Golden Age (750-1258 CE)

## Key Contributions:

| Field | Advances |
|-------|----------|
| Mathematics | Algebra, algorithms |
| Astronomy | Star catalogs, instruments |
| Medicine | Hospitals, pharmacology |
| Chemistry | Distillation, acids |
| Optics | Light and vision |

## Major Scholars:
- Al-Khwarizmi (mathematics)
- Ibn Sina/Avicenna (medicine)
- Ibn al-Haytham/Alhazen (optics)
- Al-Razi (chemistry)

## Preservation:
- Translated Greek texts
- Preserved and expanded knowledge

slides.title: Islamic Mathematics
slides.content:
# Islamic Mathematics

## Al-Khwarizmi (780-850):
- Father of algebra
- 'Al-jabr' = algebra
- 'Algorithm' from his name
- Hindu-Arabic numerals

## Contributions:
- Quadratic equations
- Decimal system spread
- Trigonometry advances

## Other Mathematicians:
- Omar Khayyam (cubic equations)
- Al-Karaji (polynomials)
- Nasir al-Din Tusi (trigonometry)

## Legacy:
- Foundation for modern math
- Number system we use today

slides.title: Medieval Astronomy
slides.content:
# Medieval Astronomy

## Islamic Astronomy:
- Improved Ptolemaic model
- Better observations
- New instruments

## Instruments:
| Instrument | Use |
|------------|-----|
| Astrolabe | Position, time |
| Quadrant | Angle measurement |
| Armillary sphere | Celestial model |

## Star Names:
Many stars have Arabic names:
- Aldebaran, Betelgeuse
- Rigel, Vega, Altair

## Copernicus Precursors:
- Tusi couple
- Ibn al-Shatir's models
- Influenced later revolution

slides.title: Medieval Medicine
slides.content:
# Medieval Medicine

## Ibn Sina/Avicenna (980-1037):
- Canon of Medicine
- Used for 600 years
- Systematic medical knowledge

## Al-Razi/Rhazes (854-925):
- Differentiated measles and smallpox
- Clinical observation

## Hospitals:
- Bimaristans
- First teaching hospitals
- Treatment for all

## Medical Advances:
- Surgical techniques
- Pharmacology
- Ophthalmology
- Anatomy knowledge

slides.title: Optics
slides.content:
# Medieval Optics

## Ibn al-Haytham (965-1040):
- Book of Optics
- Father of modern optics
- Scientific method pioneer

## Discoveries:
- Light travels in straight lines
- Reflection and refraction
- Camera obscura
- Eye receives light (not emits)

## Vision Theory:
- Disproved emission theory
- Eye as receiving device
- Analysis of perception

## Legacy:
- Influenced Kepler, Newton
- Foundation of optical science

slides.title: European Medieval Science
slides.content:
# European Medieval Science

## Translation Movement:
- Arabic works to Latin
- Toledo, Spain center
- 12th century renaissance

## Universities:
- Bologna (1088)
- Paris (1150)
- Oxford (1167)
- Cambridge (1209)

## Curriculum:
- Trivium (grammar, rhetoric, logic)
- Quadrivium (arithmetic, geometry, music, astronomy)

## Key Figures:
- Thomas Aquinas (theology and reason)
- Roger Bacon (experimentation)
- Robert Grosseteste (optics)

slides.title: Scholasticism
slides.content:
# Scholasticism

## Definition:
- Philosophical method
- Reconcile faith and reason
- Aristotle + Christianity

## Key Figures:
- Thomas Aquinas (1225-1274)
- Peter Abelard (1079-1142)
- Albertus Magnus (1200-1280)

## Method:
- Question proposed
- Objections listed
- Counter-arguments given
- Analysis and synthesis

## Science Impact:
- Rational inquiry encouraged
- Natural philosophy studied
- Prepared ground for Scientific Revolution

slides.title: Medieval Technology
slides.content:
# Medieval Technology

## Innovations:

| Technology | Impact |
|------------|--------|
| Heavy plow | Agriculture |
| Horse collar | Transportation |
| Windmills | Power |
| Mechanical clock | Timekeeping |
| Eyeglasses | Vision |
| Printing press | Knowledge |

## Gunpowder:
- From China via Islamic world
- Changed warfare
- Required new engineering

## Architecture:
- Gothic cathedrals
- Flying buttresses
- Stained glass technology

slides.title: Legacy
slides.content:
# Legacy of Medieval Science

## Transmission of Knowledge:
- Greek -> Arabic -> Latin
- Preservation during 'Dark Ages'
- Foundation for Renaissance

## Institutional Developments:
- Universities
- Libraries
- Scholarly networks

## Scientific Ideas:
- Mathematical analysis
- Experimental approach
- Systematic observation

## Path to Revolution:
- Medieval contributions often overlooked
- Continuous development
- Not a sudden awakening

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Medieval Science Summary

## Islamic Golden Age:
| Scholar | Field |
|---------|-------|
| Al-Khwarizmi | Mathematics |
| Ibn Sina | Medicine |
| Ibn al-Haytham | Optics |

## Key Developments:
- Algebra and algorithms
- Hospitals and medicine
- Understanding of light
- Universities founded

## European Contributions:
- Scholasticism
- Translation movement
- Technological innovation

## Legacy:
- Preserved ancient knowledge
- Advanced multiple fields
- Set stage for Scientific Revolution
